answers.author: Israel Murguia
answers.text:
Hi,
To begin, the following is an article from the Wall Street Journal that discusses this increasingly common trend of providing naming rights to plug budget gaps. The article may be useful in providing you with some examples. Here is the link: http://online.wsj.com/article_email/SB10001424052748703350104575652763782808830-lMyQjAxMTAwMDEwNzExNDcyWj.html. 
In addition, you will want to look at the link below which has material on general discussion over the subject, policies from local governments in Washington, and sample marketing promotions. I hope this helps. Good luck on your research! 
http://www.mrsc.org/subjects/parks/parksponsor.aspx

author: Samantha Timko
text:
I'm in the process of researching cities that have utilized a policy concerning selling naming rights to municipal FACILITIES (not so much on the transportation front).  Does anyone have example policies, success stories, and/or related information on expenses and annual revenue they would be willing to share? 
Much thanks!
title: Naming Rights
